intro: Pedicularis lutescens subsp. tongtchuanensis, commonly known as the Tongtchuan yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic or semi-parasitic growth habit. The plant typically features showy yellow to orange-red flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and often reduced, with a fleshy texture adapted to its harsh environment. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
